>> The House will come to order,

>> Thank you Mr.
Speaker, please pray with me.
Oh God, we begin this session by giving thanks,
we are thankful
for the beautiful day before us and the coming rain that will nourish
our land and soul.
We are thankful for this work to serve the people of North Carolina
, we are thankful for our family and friends who support us in
this work And we pray for your guidance.
We come to you from different backgrounds and understanding for
who you are.
Some of us have a deep faith and some of us have no faith at all.
Still we take this time to pause and reflect on what unifies us
instead of what divides us.
We care for the people of North Carolina and seeK
What is best for them,
when none of the power of love that can transform
people and ask for your love to be expressed through us,
when none
of the power of respect and ask for the ability to listen and hear
from different points of view.
When other power of grace and ask that we are able to offer grace
and receive grace during the times we make mistakes Mistakes that
are not kind.
We pray for the work we have before us,
and the conversation we
have together will better inform us to the decisions we will make.
We pray for the people of North Carolina and the different hardships
we're all going through.
We pray for the many communities throughout the state as they reach
out and support each other in life May we discover what it really
means to partner together through love and grace for sake of men
and women through the great State of North Carolina and beyond,
Amen. >> I pledge allegiance to the Flag of the United States of America,

one Nation under God,

House joint resolution 977,
a joint resolution providing for the
confirmation of Gregory McGuire as special superior court judge.
The house resolves [INAUDIBLE]
>> The gentleman from Harnett,
Representative
Lewis is recognized to debate the resolution.
Thank you Mr.
Speaker.
Mr.
Speaker and members,
Judge McGuire was appointed the special superior
court judge by Governor Pat McCory/g in 2014 to fill the unexpired
term of superior court judge Lisa Bale.
He was subsequently assigned to the North Carolina business court
for complex But business cases.
Prior to his appointments to the bench he was a shareholder with
the all three deacons wall firm.
One of the nations leading work place law firms where he spent 26
years as a counselor and a litigator for companies of different
sizes.
Judge McGuire obtained his Bachelor of Science from Cornell University
University and as Juris Doctor from the University of North Carolina
Chapel Hill, I respectfully ask the members of this body to confirm
the appointment of Gregory McGuire as a special superior court
Judge.
Thank you Mr.
Speaker.
>> What purpose does the gentleman from Wake,
Representative Martin
rise?
>> To debate the resolution
The gentleman has the floor to debate the resolution.
>> Thank you very much Mr Speaker members I was pleased in day one
to meet and consider the nomination of three of the judges that
are before us today including Mr Maguire.
After reading their backgrounds and hearing from them all extremely
well qualified and was pleased to support their nomination in day
one and certainly will be doing the same here on the floor.
I commend the governor for sending forth a good slate of nominees
I do think if I'll delve deep into the politics I might find several
disagreements.
But that's not the standards I think,
by which we judge our nominations.
We look at their qualifications patience and these gentlemen certainly
deserve our support.
I'm most pleased though that we at North Carolina are ignoring the
advice of those perhaps in DC who would say that in election year
where they're appointing member of the executive branch is up for
reelection that legislator Branch/g should not consider an important
judicial nomination.
We're doing our
Our job here and proceeding with the people's business.
Some would argue that we should let the people have their say in
the gubernatorial election coming up.
Well, the people had their say,
elected Governor Croy, he did his
job, it's time for us in the legislative branch to do our job.
>> For what purpose does the gentleman from Mecklenburg Rep Jude
arise?
To debate The hypothetical discussion in Washington apparently.
>> The gentleman is recognized to debate the resolution.
>> You know I don't quite understand why this gentleman is being
tied into national politics last time I checked we were elected
to handle state issues so I appreciate the commentary from my good
friend Friend from wake I do believe it is out of order and I had
asked the members not to consider it.
>> What purpose has the gentleman from [INAUDIBLE] representative
Hallrise/g.
>> Speaker on the resolution.
>> The gentleman has the floor to debate the resolution.

the processes prescribed for
For us to review this nominee and then give him a vote as our constitution
and our state regulations require so I hope that you have taken
time to look at his qualifications he did get a review in J1 I
believe and so it would be hovers to honor our honor our process
and do our part to give him a clean and clear review thank you.

>> Thank you Mr speaker excuse me on April 13th 2016 Governor Pat

North Carolina State Bureau of investigation,
Mr.
Schumayer has nearly 30 years of experience in the law enforcement
field with the Charlotte Mecklenburg police department where he
served in numerous different roles and divisions of the department.
He established the Charlotte Mecklenburg police department Volunteer
homicide cold case unit and pioneered initiatives that have become
models for other law enforcement agencies.
Since his retirement in 2004,
he has served as president of a private
investigative and security consulting firm.
He is a graduate of the University of North Carolina Chapel Hill
as well as the FBI National Academy.
He currently resides in Iredell county with his wife Tricia and
their daughter.
I concur and I
Recommend a nomination.

>>Thank you.
I'll be very brief.
My sheriff called me to encourage me to support this resolution.
Mr.
Schumeyer lives in my district,
I'm very pleased and proud to recommend
him to you and ask for your support on this resolution.
Thank you.

Ladies and gentlemen of the House.
I rise today to ask you to support this nomination of Mr.
Schumeyer.
He got.
You've heard of his record in law enforcement.
I will give you a little personal perspective.
My husband who just retired as the Aviation Director for Operations
at Charlotte Douglas airport.
He worked very closely with Mr.
Schumeyer and said all that he could say about him as he is a great
guy but he's a man of
The man of high integrity,
and I'll tell you that I do believe he
will be fair but he will be tough in his role and I ask for your
support.
>> For what purpose does the gentleman from Guildford Representative
Faircloth rise?
>> To speak to the resolution.
>> The gentleman has the floor to debate the resolution.
>> Thank you Mr speaker.
This is an important decision we make.
We make some changes in the structure of the SBI leadership a couple
of years ago and this an appointment which is a eight year appointment
and requires someone who can not only hold an office in state government
but can bring to that office the experience necessarily to interact
with other government employees with people who are charged with
enforcing their laws all the way across the state.
Mr Shumeyer is very well qualified,
he comes from local government
law enforcement and i think that's a plus.
He is well respected in the field by the FBI agents that know him.
And I think he will bring a quality to this office that we all be
proud of and I recommend him highly.
>> Further discussion for the debate for what purpose does the gentleman

speaker.
He's certainly a fine nominee and again I wanna congratulate the
house and the legislature as well as the other members of the government
who have stepped up and done our duty to make sure this nominee
gets vetted and we provide our approval and as I look at all five
of the nominees had come before as well as this one the great qualifications
and skills that they bring to this positions and I just would hope
and challenge us to also look to the future of North Carolina as
we select who will serve in this great positions and try to find
more diversities so more of our state will feel included in
these decisions and important as we make.
Thank you, Mr.
Speaker.
